snippet: Police Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly appeared before the council to outline the Police Department’s budget, but council members seized the chance to discuss civil rights topics.
abstract: New York City Police Commissioner Raymond W Kelly appears before City Council to outline Police Department’s budget, but council members seize chance to discuss civil rights topics; their questions seem to have little to do with budget and veer into thinly veiled criticism of department’s use of its 'stop, question and frisk' tactic and other similar topics.
lead_paragraph: Police Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly appeared before the council to outline the Police Department’s budget, but council members seized the chance to discuss civil rights topics.

headline.seo: Kelly Questioned on Stop-and-Frisk Tactic at Council Budget Meeting
headline.main: Kelly Questioned on Stop-and-Frisk Tactic at Council Budget Meeting
headline.print_headline: Kelly Questioned on Stop-and-Frisk Tactic at Council Budget Meeting
